name: ALAssetsGroup
desc: An ALAssetsGroup object represents an ordered set of the assets managed by the Photos application. The order of the elements is the same as the user sees in the Photos application. An asset can belong to multiple assets groups.

items.name: func enumerateAssets(ALAssetsGroupEnumerationResultsBlock!)
items.desc: Invokes a given block using each of the assets in the group.

items.name: func enumerateAssets(options: NSEnumerationOptions, using: ALAssetsGroupEnumerationResultsBlock!)
items.desc: Invokes a given block using each of the assets in the group.

items.name: func enumerateAssets(at: IndexSet!, options: NSEnumerationOptions, using: ALAssetsGroupEnumerationResultsBlock!)
items.desc: Invokes a given block using each of the assets in the group at specified indexes.

items.name: func add(ALAsset!) -> Bool
items.desc: Adds an existing asset to the receiver.

items.name: var isEditable: Bool
items.desc: Indicates whether the application can edit the group.

items.name: func numberOfAssets() -> Int
items.desc: Returns the number of assets in the group that match the current filter.

items.name: func setAssetsFilter(ALAssetsFilter!)
items.desc: Sets the filter for the group.

items.name: func value(forProperty: String!) -> Any!
items.desc: Returns the group’s value for a given property.

items.name: typealias ALAssetsGroupEnumerationResultsBlock
items.desc: Signature for the block executed during enumeration of assets.
